definition: Descendants of the Dragon (i.e. Han Chinese)
of/~'s (possessive particle)/(used after an attribute)/(used to form a nominal expression)/(used at the end of a declarative sentence for emphasis)
to pass on/to spread/to transmit/to infect/to transfer/to circulate/to conduct (electricity)

sentences.english: We Chinese often consider ourselves "the descendants of the dragon."
sentences.chinese: 我们中国人经常称自己为“龙的传人”。

sentences.english: This user is a Descendant of the Dragon .
Just like the song goes, "always an heir of the dragon".
sentences.chinese: 就像歌里唱得一样，“永永远远是龙的传人。”

definition: descendants of the Fiery Emperor and the Yellow Emperor (i.e. Han Chinese people)
lit. the flame of a burning piece of firewood passes on to the rest (idiom)/fig. (of knowledge, skill etc) to be passed on from teachers to students, one generation to another
the dragon and phoenix are symbols of good fortune (idiom)/auspicious/decorated with auspicious symbols such as the dragon and the phoenix
old but still full of vitality (idiom)
to succeed in life/to become somebody
Jackie Chan (1954-), kungfu film and Cantopop star

Greater China/refers to China, Taiwan, Hong Kong and Macau (esp. in finance and economics)/refers to all areas of Chinese presence (esp. in the cultural field), including parts of Southeast Asia, Europe and the Americas
